Its reasoning for nominating Gordon was to promote his work in conjunction with the biennial, which will take place at the Brooklyn Museum in New York from March 19 to March 21, 2020.“Stuart Gordon’s work represents a new and vibrant kind of photographic imagination, conceived as a sort of interpretive matrix of the world, with its turbulent and inscrutable movements,” said Aliyev. Gordon’s work, which was shown at the Venice Biennale in 2012, is set in an alternate history where the United Kingdom has been split into two countries: Great Britain and Northern Ireland. The exhibition will run in conjunction with the Biennale, which is currently on view in London.
